_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Solvay USA Inc. - Vernon, TX, Facility

Facility EPA ID No. 1000 0004 0831



PLANT GEOGRAPHICAL DESCRIPTION:



The Solvay USA Inc. Vernon, TX, Facility is located on ~40 acres on the north side of the city of Vernon, Wilbarger County, Texas. The property is bounded on the north by the Burlington Northern/Santa Fe Railway, on the west by Harrison Street, on the south by Sullivan Street, and on the east by the acreage of private landowners.  This land is in two sections bisected by the Texas Department of Transportation ditch which eventually empties into the Pease River that is located ~2 miles north and east of the plant site.  The North 35 acres contain all plant processes, storage and wastewater treatment facilities.  Runoff water and/or a possible spill is channeled to a nominal 500,000 gallon concrete basin to catch the first flush of possibly contaminated rain water or emergency use water (ie., deluge, fire hydrant/sprinkler, etc.)



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY:



The Vernon Plant complies with Solvay's Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, which meets or exceeds the minimum requirements of OSHA's Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals standard (29 CFR 1910.119), as well as the EPA's Risk Management Program for Chemical Accident Prevention (40 CFR 68). 



The Vernon Plant conducts periodic audits of its PSM & RMP programs to evaluate compliance with the regulatory standards, and develops action plans to ensure prompt correction of any deficiencies noted during these audits.



Solvay's PSM Program addresses the following 14 elements:



     1.    Management Review & Commitment

     2.    Employee Participation 

     3.    Process Safety Information for Chemicals, Technology & Equipment

     4.    Process Hazard Analysis

     5.    Operating Procedures

     6.    Training Program

     7.    Contractor Safety Management

     8.    Pre-startup Safety Reviews

     9.    Mechanical Integrity / Maintenance Management Program

10.    Work Permit System (Safe Work Practices)

    11.    Management of Change

    12.    Incident Investigation

    13.    Emergency Planning & Response

    14.    Compliance Audits



PROCESS AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:



The Vernon Plant produces various specialty chemicals by reacting guar beans with propylene oxide and other chemicals.  Propylene Oxide, the only substance on the plant site that is regulated by PSM & RMP, is stored in two 30,000 gallon above-ground storage tanks. Propylene Oxide is delivered by railcar.

In addition to propylene oxide, the Vernon Plant also uses other non-regulated chemicals in its processes, to manufacture a variety of products, both derivatized and non-derivatized, that are sold to a number of different industries which include, but are not limited to, the following;  oil field chemicals, textiles, mining, food, cosmetics and fire-fighting industries.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND PROPYLENE OXIDE SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:



Management at the Vernon Plant is confident that by utilizing the 14 elements of Solvay's PSM program that process incidents can be prevented.  In addition, all plant employees have received training on all 14 elements, and their participation is required in every aspect of the site's PSM Program.



The Operator Training program at the Vernon Plant is very extensive, ongoing and includes the following:



      > 40 hours of Entry Level Operator Training

      > Operator Job/Skills Performance Demonstration and Testing

      > Propylene Oxide Testing/Certification

      > D.O.T. Hazardous Material Awareness Training

      > Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response Training 



The Vernon Plant also has an extensive Preventive Maintenance program which includes systematic testing and maintenance of process safety controls and devices.  The propylene oxide handling and storage operations are equipped with the following process safety controls and devices:



      > Press

ure Relief Valves

      > Excess Flow Prevention Valves

      > High Temperature / High Pressure Indicators, Alarms and Interlocks

      > High Temperature / High Pressure Shutdown and Flood System

      > Nitrogen Purging System

      > IST Model 4-20IQ Propylene Oxide Leak Detection/Alarm System

      > Computerized Process Controls with Hardwired Safety Trips



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:



The Vernon Plant has not experienced any RMP-reportable accidents related to Propylene Oxide Handling and Storage Operations, over the last 5-year period.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:



Solvay USA Inc., Vernon Facility has a written emergency response plan that addresses accidental releases of the hazardous chemicals on site.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including incident command system of response management, adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas and critique of the response. The site has established Emergency Response & Support teams consisting of plant personnel trained and prepared to respond to emergency situations.

 To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is periodically inspected, and tested and serviced as needed. Site-wide emergency preparedness drills are conducted periodically and response critiqued for improvement opportunities. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes in our processes that would require a modified emergency response.

The Vernon site is part of the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) whose representatives meet quarterly to discuss issues pertinent to Emergency Response, Changes in Regulations, and committee matters. The Vernon Fire Department is the designated responder for all site releases & spills of Propylene Oxide.



PLANNED CHANGES TO CONTINUE IMPROVEMENT TO SAFETY:



Solvay's PSM program requires development of annu

al HSE Plans for site management review & commitment.  The Vernon Plant's plan includes the following planned items:



      >    Conduct a Safeguard Operability Audit.

      >    Conduct a Management of Change Audit.

      >    Update Process Safety Information as changes are made or as new information becomes available.

      >    Complete 5-year PHA revalidation for PO Handling & Storage.
